sen.j: 浅野 幸長（あさの よしなが）は、安土桃山時代から江戸時代にかけての戦国武将・大名。
sen.e: Yoshinaga ASANO was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period and daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the Edo period.
Yoshinaga ASANO was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period and a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the Edo period.
Yoshinaga ASANO was a busho (Japanese military commander) in the Sengoku period and a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) in the Azuchi-Momoyama period and the Edo period.

sen.j: 紀伊国紀州藩の初代藩主。
sen.e: The first lord of domain of the Kishu Domain, Kii Privince.
The first lord of the Kishu Domain, Kii Province.
sen.cmt: domain ofを削除Provinceのスペルミスを修正
sen.e: The first lord of the Kishu Domain, Kii Province.

sen.j: 浅野家宗家初代。
sen.e: The first head of the Asano family.
The first head of the Asano family.
The first head of the Asano family.

sen.j: 正室は池田恒興の娘。
sen.e: His lawful wife was the daughter of Tsuneoki IKEDA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Tsuneoki IKEDA.
His lawful wife was a daughter of Tsuneoki IKEDA.

sen.j: 子は春姫（徳川義直室）、花姫（（松平忠昌室）
sen.e: His children were Haruhime (Princess Haru) (wife of Yoshinao TOKUGAWA) and Hanahime (Princess Hana) (wife of Tadamasa MATSUDAIRA).
sen.cmt: 原文には「(」が一つ余分についています。
sen.e: His children were Haruhime (Princess Haru) (wife of Yoshinao TOKUGAWA) and Hanahime (Princess Hana) (wife of Tadamasa MATSUDAIRA).
His children were Haruhime (Princess Haru) (wife of Yoshinao TOKUGAWA) and Hanahime (Princess Hana) (wife of Tadamasa MATSUDAIRA).

sen.j: 天正4年（1576年）、近江国浅井郡小谷（滋賀県湖北町）に浅野長政の長男として生まれる。
sen.e: Yoshinaga ASANO was born as the eldest son of Nagamasa ASANO in 1576, in Kodani, Asai-gun, Omi Province (Kohoku-cho, Shiga Prefecture).
Yoshinaga ASANO was born as the eldest son of Nagamasa ASANO in 1576, in Kodani, Asai-gun, Omi Province (Kohoku-cho, Shiga Prefecture).
Yoshinaga ASANO was born as the eldest son of Nagamasa ASANO in 1576, in Kodani, Asai-gun, Omi Province (Kohoku-cho, Shiga Prefecture).

sen.j: 父の長政は豊臣秀吉の正室おね（高台院）の義弟である。
sen.e: His father was the brother-in-law of One (Kodai-in), the lawful wife of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His father was the brother-in-law of One (Kodai-in), the lawful wife of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
His father was the brother-in-law of One (Kodai-in), the lawful wife of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 豊臣政権では五奉行の1人となっている。
sen.e: Yoshinaga became one of the Gobugyo (five major magistrates) in the Toyotomi government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yoshinaga became one of the Gobugyo (five major magistrates) in the Toyotomi government.
Yoshinaga became one of the Gobugyo (five major magistrates) in the Toyotomi government.

sen.j: 天正18年（1590年）に後北条氏征伐（小田原合戦）に参加している。
sen.e: He joined the conquest of Gohojo clan (Odawara Campaign) in 1590.
He joined the conquest of Gohojo clan (Odawara Campaign) in 1590.
He joined the conquest of Gohojo clan (Odawara Campaign) in 1590.

sen.j: 文禄・慶長の役にも父とともに軍を率いて出陣、慶長2年（1597年）には蔚山倭城（現在の蔚山広域市内）に籠城し、奮戦している。
sen.e: He led a force in the Bunroku-Keicho War along with his father, and fought hard by holding the Ulsan Waeseong (Ulsan Japanese Castle) (current Ulsan Metropolitan City) in 1597.
He led a force in the Bunroku-Keicho War along with his father, and fought hard by holding the Ulsan Waeseong (Ulsan Japanese Castle) (current Ulsan Metropolitan City) in 1597.
He led a force in the Bunroku-Keicho War along with his father, and fought hard by holding the Ulsan Waeseong (Ulsan Japanese Castle) (current Ulsan Metropolitan City) in 1597.

sen.j: 文禄2年（1593年）に父とともに甲斐国府中（山梨県甲府市）を与えられた。
sen.e: In 1593, he and his father were granted Fuchu, Kai Province (Kofu City, Yamanashi Prefecture).
In 1593, he and his father were granted Fuchu, Kai Province (Kofu City, Yamanashi Prefecture).
In 1593, he and his father were granted Fuchu, Kai Province (Kofu City, Yamanashi Prefecture).

sen.j: 文禄4年（1595年）、関白・豊臣秀次の失脚に連座し能登国（石川県東部）に配流されたが、前田利家・徳川家康のとりなしもあってまもなく復帰した。
sen.e: He was exiled to Noto Province (the eastern part of Ishikawa Prefecture) in 1595 by being implicated by the downfall of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, the chief adviser to the Emperor, but soon returned thanks to the arrangement made by Toshiie MAEDA and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

He was exiled to Noto Province (the eastern part of Ishikawa Prefecture) in 1595 by being implicated in the downfall of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, the chief adviser to the Emperor, but soon returned thanks to the arrangement made by Toshiie MAEDA and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

He was exiled to Noto Province (the eastern part of Ishikawa Prefecture) in 1595 by being implicated in the downfall of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, the chief adviser to the Emperor, but soon returned thanks to the arrangement made by Toshiie MAEDA and Ieyasu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 慶長3年（1598年）8月の秀吉没後は、朝鮮でともに戦った加藤清正・福島正則ら武断派に与し、五奉行の文治派・石田三成らと対立した。
sen.e: After the death of Hideyoshi in August 1598, he sided with Budan-ha (a political faction that is willing to resort to military means to achieve its aims) along with Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA with whom he faught in Korea, and was against Bunchi faction (a political faction that is against Budan-ha) such as Mitsunari ISHIDA of the Gobugyo.

After the death of Hideyoshi in August 1598, he sided with Budan-ha (a political faction that is willing to resort to military means to achieve its aims) along with Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA with whom he fought in Korea, and was against Bunchi faction (a political faction that is against Budan-ha) such as Mitsunari ISHIDA of the Gobugyo.

After the death of Hideyoshi in August 1598, he sided with Budan-ha (a political faction that is willing to resort to military means to achieve its aims) along with Kiyomasa KATO and Masanori FUKUSHIMA with whom he fought in Korea, and was against Bunchi faction (a political faction that is against Budan-ha) such as Mitsunari ISHIDA of the Gobugyo.

sen.j: 慶長4年（1599年）の前田利家没後には福島・加藤らと共に石田三成を襲撃している。
sen.e: When Toshiie MAEDA died in 1599, he attacked Mitsunari ISHIDA with Fukushima and Kato.
When Toshiie MAEDA died in 1599, he attacked Mitsunari ISHIDA with Fukushima and Kato.
When Toshiie MAEDA died in 1599, he attacked Mitsunari ISHIDA with Fukushima and Kato.

sen.j: 慶長5年（1600年）9月の関ヶ原の戦いでは徳川家康率いる東軍に属し、南宮山付近に布陣して毛利秀元、長束正家などの西軍勢を牽制した。
sen.e: At the the Battle of Sekigahara which occurred in September 1600, he sided with the East squad led by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, lined up around Mt. Nangu and diverted the West squad such as Hidemoto MORI and Masaie NAGATSUKA.

At the the Battle of Sekigahara which occurred in September 1600, he sided with the East squad led by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, lined up around Mt. Nangu and diverted the West squad such as Hidemoto MORI and Masaie NAGATSUKA.

At the the Battle of Sekigahara which occurred in September 1600, he sided with the East squad led by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, lined up around Mt. Nangu and diverted the West squad such as Hidemoto MORI and Masaie NAGATSUKA.

sen.j: 戦後には紀伊国和歌山城に37万6千石を与えられる。
sen.e: After the battle, he was granted 376,000 koku of estate in the Wakayama-jo Castle, Kii Province.
After the battle, he was granted 376,000 koku crop yields in the Wakayama-jo Castle, Kii Province.
After the battle, he was granted 376,000 koku crop yields in the Wakayama-jo Castle, Kii Province.

sen.j: 慶長16年（1611年）の二条城における家康と豊臣秀頼の会談で、加藤清正と共に警備も行う。
sen.e: He also served as a guard along with Kiyomasa KATO at the meeting between Ieyasu and Hideyori TOYOTOMI held at the NIjo-jo Castle in 1611.
He also served as a guard along with Kiyomasa KATO at the meeting between Ieyasu and Hideyori TOYOTOMI held at the NIjo-jo Castle in 1611.
He also served as a guard along with Kiyomasa KATO at the meeting between Ieyasu and Hideyori TOYOTOMI held at the NIjo-jo Castle in 1611.

sen.j: 慶長18年（1613年）8月25日に和歌山で死去した。
sen.e: He died in Wakayama on August 25, 1613.
He died in Wakayama on August 25, 1613.
He died in Wakayama on August 25, 1613.

sen.j: 享年38。
sen.e: Died at the age of 38.
Died at the age of 38.
Died at the age of 38.

sen.j: 男子が無かったため、弟の浅野長晟が後を継いだ。
sen.e: Since he did not have a son, his brother Nagaakira ASANO succeeded him.
Since he did not have a son, his brother Nagaakira ASANO succeeded him.
Since he did not have a son, his brother Nagaakira ASANO succeeded him.

sen.j: 墓所：和歌山県伊都郡高野町の高野山悉地院。
sen.e: Tomb: Koyasan-Shicchi-in Temple in Koya-cho Itogun Wakayama Prefecture.
Tomb: Koyasan-Shicchi-in Temple in Koya-cho Itogun Wakayama Prefecture.
Tomb: Koyasan-Shicchi-in Temple in Koya-cho Itogun Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 和歌山市吹上の曹源山大泉寺。
sen.e: Sogenzan, Daisen-ji Temple in Fukiage, Wakayama City.
Sogenzan, Daisen-ji Temple in Fukiage, Wakayama City.
Sogenzan, Daisen-ji Temple in Fukiage, Wakayama City.

sen.j: 幸長の死後、家督をめぐって弟の長晟と長重が争い、その末に長晟が継いだといわれている。
sen.e: After the death of Yoshinaga, his brothers Nagaakira and Nagashige fought against each other over the reign of the family, and consequently, Nagaakira succeeded the family.
After the death of Yoshinaga, his brothers Nagaakira and Nagashige fought against each other over the reign of the family, and consequently, Nagaakira succeeded the family.
After the death of Yoshinaga, his brothers Nagaakira and Nagashige fought against each other over the reign of the family, and consequently, Nagaakira succeeded the family.

sen.j: 幸長の死の翌年から大坂冬の陣が始まり、慶長20年（1615年）に豊臣氏は家康により滅ぼされた。
sen.e: Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka) occurred from the next year of Yoshinaga's death, and the Toyotomi clan was defeated by Ieyasu in 1615.
Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka) occurred from the next year of Yoshinaga's death, and the Toyotomi clan was defeated by Ieyasu in 1615.
Osaka Fuyu no Jin (Winter Siege of Osaka) occurred from the next year of Yoshinaga's death, and the Toyotomi clan was defeated by Ieyasu in 1615.

sen.j: また、長晟の代の元和5年（1619年）、福島家の改易に伴い浅野家は安芸国広島藩に加増転封される。
sen.e: In 1619 during the period of Nagaakira, the Asano clan gained more territories due to the Fukushima clan being punished by being deprived of one's fief.
In 1619 during the period of Nagaakira, the Asano clan gained more territories due to the Fukushima clan being punished by being deprived of one's fief.
In 1619 during the period of Nagaakira, the Asano clan gained more territories due to the Fukushima clan being punished by being deprived of one's fief.

sen.j: 武勇に優れていた歴戦の勇将であり、その武勇には諸大名も一目置いていたと言われている。
sen.e: Yoshinaga was a brave general with a history of military prowess, and it is said that territorial lords acknowledged his prowess.
Yoshinaga was a brave general with a history of military prowess, and it is said that territorial lords acknowledged his prowess.
Yoshinaga was a brave general with a history of military prowess, and it is said that territorial lords acknowledged his prowess.

sen.j: 幸長は加藤清正と同じく徳川家康の天下を認めながらも、終生にわたって豊臣氏に忠誠を誓い続けた。
sen.e: Although Yoshinaga admitted the realm of Ieyasu TOKUNAGA like Kiyomasa KATO did, he was loyal to the Toyotomi clan all his life.
Although Yoshinaga admitted the realm of Ieyasu TOKUNAGA like Kiyomasa KATO did, he was loyal to the Toyotomi clan all his life.
Although Yoshinaga admitted the realm of Ieyasu TOKUNAGA like Kiyomasa KATO did, he was loyal to the Toyotomi clan all his life.

sen.j: そのため、清正同様に家康一派によって暗殺されたのではないかという説もある。
sen.e: Therefore, a theory says that he was assassinated by the Ieyasu group like Kiyomasa.
Therefore, a theory says that he was assassinated by the Ieyasu group like Kiyomasa.
Therefore, a theory says that he was assassinated by the Ieyasu group like Kiyomasa.

sen.j: 清正、福島正則と共に石田三成嫌いで、武断派の重鎮である。
sen.e: He disliked Mitsunari ISHIDA, so did Kiyomasa and Masanori FUKUSHIMA; he was a grand person in the Budan-ha.
He disliked Mitsunari ISHIDA, so did Kiyomasa and Masanori FUKUSHIMA; he was a grand person in the Budan-ha.
He disliked Mitsunari ISHIDA, so did Kiyomasa and Masanori FUKUSHIMA; he was a grand person in the Budan-ha.

sen.j: また、学問にも熱心で、藤原惺窩・堀正意らに師事していた。
sen.e: He was also dedicated to learning, and studied under Seika FUJIWARA and Seii HORI.
sen.cmt: 堀正意の読み方はこちらから↓http://www.harikyu.com/ftp/dos/ika.txt
sen.e: He was also dedicated to learning, and studied under Seika FUJIWARA and Seii HORI.
He was also dedicated to learning, and studied under Seika FUJIWARA and Seii HORI.

sen.j: 幸長の死因は腎虚（花柳病）であるが、これは清正と同じ死因である。
sen.e: Yoshinaga's cause of death was renal ischemia (social diseases), which was the same as the cause of death of Kiyomasa.
Yoshinaga's cause of death was renal ischemia (social diseases), which was the same as the cause of death of Kiyomasa.
Yoshinaga's cause of death was renal ischemia (social diseases), which was the same as the cause of death of Kiyomasa.

sen.j: 幸長の死の翌年に家康が大坂冬の陣を発動したことを考えると、近年では暗殺説も有力とされている。
sen.e: Considering the fact that Ieyasu raised Osaka Fuyu no Jin in the next year of Yoshinaga's death, more and more people began to think that the assassination theory is quite credible.
Considering the fact that Ieyasu raised Osaka Fuyu no Jin in the next year of Yoshinaga's death, more and more people began to think that the assassination theory is quite credible.

sen.j: 但し、梅毒なら罹患してから死亡するまで10年以上かかる。
sen.e: However, if in the case of syphilis, it would take more than 10 years from being infected with the desease to die.
However, if in the case of syphilis, it would take more than 10 years from being infected with the disease to die.

sen.j: これから感染時期を逆算すると朝鮮の役の陣中に遊女に接触して感染したとも考えられる。
sen.e: When calculating this fact, it is possible that he got infected with the desease from a prostitute when he was at the War in Korea.
